Remove a graph from a graph series

Source: R/remove_graph_from_graph_series.R
remove_graph_from_graph_series.Rd

Remove a single graph object from an set of graph objects contained within a graph series object.

remove_graph_from_graph_series(graph_series, index = "last")

Arguments

graph_series

a graph series object from which the graph object will be removed.
index

the index of the graph object to be removed from the graph series object.

Value

a graph series object of type dgr_graph_1D.

Examples

# Create three graphs
graph_1 <-
  create_graph() %>%
  add_path(n = 4)

graph_2 <-
  create_graph() %>%
  add_cycle(n = 5)

graph_3 <-
  create_graph() %>%
  add_star(n = 6)

# Create an empty graph series
# and add the graphs
series <-
  create_graph_series() %>%
  add_graph_to_graph_series(
    graph = graph_1) %>%
  add_graph_to_graph_series(
    graph = graph_2) %>%
  add_graph_to_graph_series(
    graph = graph_3)

# Remove the second graph
# from the graph series
series <-
  series %>%
  remove_graph_from_graph_series(
    index = 2)

# With `get_graph_series_info()`,
# we can ensure that a graph
# was removed
series %>%
  get_graph_series_info()
#>   graph           name           date_time              tz nodes edges directed
#> 1     1 graph_mkRJxXyq 2018-12-03 00:55:56 America/Toronto     4     3     TRUE
#> 2     2 graph_ySz3BP7j 2018-12-03 00:55:57 America/Toronto     6     5     TRUE
